3: Good morning.
Routine testing of the Mind Beacon commencing.
Whirr—a blue light sweeps across the head of the white-haired girl.
Mind Beacon grid projection complete. Dependencies... Uh, let's leave that value alone for now.
The white-haired girl lies motionlessly in the sleeping pod, not even twitching her eyes.
M.I.N.D. stability... passed. M.I.N.D. container pressure... within acceptable limits. Routine Checklist... complete.
The sleeping pod begins the air exchange necessary to open the hatch. The inert gas that serves as a barrier is sucked out through the vents of the air conditioning system.
Woosh—

The fresh air from outside instantaneously replaces the industrial-smelling inert gas. While the white-haired girl likes the sweet-smelling fresh air, she is more accustomed to the smell of the inert gas.
Air exchange complete. Vital signs... normal.
Whew... That's good.

The white-haired girl's vision is a blur. She sees a young girl timidly approach Asimov, who is working on the equipment, from behind. She does not seem to dare make a sound. A nearby engineer notices and informs Asimov, who turns around.
...Mr. Asimov, the deep probe of Mr. Chrome's M.I.N.D. has been completed in accordance with the course teachings.
Alright, I'll head over. I'll leave things here to you.
Asimov is not at all worried that the nine-year-old girl who stands before him will mess things up. She nods, climbs onto Asimov's high seat, and quietly watches his screen.
Alright, is Mr. Chrome still suffering from the effects of M.I.N.D. deviation?
No, the deviation has been recalibrated by the Gray Raven Commandant.
Based on the readings, there has been no potential for damage or changes found for now. However, we have to be on guard.
Right now, there's only one thing we can be sure of—
Asimov glances over at Rosa sitting in front of the screen. She is typing something on her terminal while looking at the records on screen.
The Glory frame's Inver-Device did encounter an abnormal Punishing Virus overload for unknown reasons.
I built a lot of protection into it to prevent such situations, but it still led to this.
Either the frame had previously undetected defects or there was something odd with the 'Mother' he was fighting against.
In short, a deep comprehensive probe of Chrome's M.I.N.D. is needed. Whatever the case may be, any such future incidences must be avoided.
Understood. Is the Gray Raven Commandant still able to help out with calibrations?
Unlikely. Medical care may have improved tremendously, but it will still take time for the commandant to fully heal.
Although the medical department has reluctantly agreed to allow the Gray Raven Commandant to move freely under medical supervision, if 【kuroname】 repeats such risky calibration...
...I can imagine how they'll react. They'll probably come after us with their bone saws.
...Alright.
On our end, there are still some things that need to be confirmed, but with Vera taking care of them, I don't foresee too many issues.
Confirm the data and the conclusion. Once that's done, this matter's concluded.
Understood.
Data confirmation... Memory Beacon grid projection uploaded to server... comparing... average deviation of 0.0014.
Within acceptable limits... data reconfirmation complete... checklist complete...
The white-haired girl in the sleeping pod completes yet another Babylonia Construct routine inspection. The sleeping pod's glass door slowly opens.
Good morning, No. 21.
...Good morning.
No. 21 knows she must be polite to the engineer carrying out maintenance on her.
No. 21 springs out of the sleeping pod.
'Snore.'
A white creature dashes out from a dark corner of the sleeping pod and runs circles around No. 21.
After a couple of circles, the white supporting Co-bot stops, as if remembering something.
What is it?
The supporting Co-bot's head spins before playing a voice message—
Is the inspection complete? If it's done, hurry over to the entrance.
No. 21 knows that she has to listen to Vera.
Okay.
Without sparing another glance at the busy Science Council engineers, No. 21 steps out of the Science Council's maintenance department.
No. 21 has a mission. Vera is waiting to take her to the location.
